data.title: Assessment Booking Form
data.text:
Please complete this form to make a booking for a Taxi Driver Assessment. Once completed, you will be taken to a secure payment form to make a payment by either credit or debit card.

]

After completing your booking form, the next steps are:

Your booking will be processed by the admin team and allocated to the Assessor who works closest to where you live.

You will be contacted within 2-3 working days by the Assessor to arrange with you a convenient date and time for your assessment.

Applicants will be expected to travel a reasonable distance to meet the Assessor.

Applicants are required to supply a vehicle for the assessment that is roadworthy, taxed and insured for the purposes of the assessment.

The Blue Lamp Trust will endeavour to arrange for your test to be completed within 15 working days of your booking.

Short Notice Booking – If you agree an assessment date with the assessor that is within 5 clear working days or less changes cannot be made to the booking and refunds will not be given. If you are unsure do not accept the date offered and contact the office on 0300 777 0157.

Cancellation Policy – Once a date and time for your assessment has been agreed between you and your assessor, you may cancel or change the appointment date up to 5 clear working days prior to the test without incurring costs.

To cancel a booking contact the Blue Lamp Trust on 0300 777 0157. Once advised we will notify the Assessor on your behalf.

Please note that your 5 clear working day cancellation period does not include weekends, bank holidays, the day of your assessment or the day you give us notice. For example, if you have a test booked for a Thursday you need to advise us by the previous Wednesday.

Please Note – In accordance with standard DVSA procedure, the decision of the driving assessor is final.

Important Message:

Private Hire – candidates are required to book a Taxi Assessment, and this will include:

Three districts and two places of local interest in Rutland taken at random and the candidate must be able to take the quickest route between each. When route planning, the candidate will need to consider possible roadworks and that the quickest route may not necessarily be the shortest route geographically.

Hackney Carriage – candidates are required to book a Combination Assessment, and this will include:

Knowledge of the county of Rutland and its environs.

A driving assessment to include 5 routes to specific destinations taken at random (if before attempting a street the candidate informs the assessor that they do not know its location an alternative street might be given on one occasion only).

Use of wheelchair accessibility features including embarking, securing, and disembarking the wheelchair. A wheelchair accessible vehicle is required for this element of the assessment.

Important Information! Portsmouth City Council candidates are only permitted to take 3 attempts at the assessment

Important Information! Please note that Southampton City Council will not licence drivers who have not held a full UK photo card licence, or equivalent, for 2 years or more.

Important Information! Oadby and Wigston Borough Council candidates are only permitted to take 3 attempts at the assessment

Important Information! Bedford Borough Council candidates are only permitted to take 2 attempts at the assessment

Important message:

Private Hire – candidates are required to book a Taxi Assessment and this will include:

When route planning, the candidate will need to consider possible roadworks and that the quickest route may not necessarily be the shortest route geographically.

Important Information (please read carefully)

This forms part of the Terms and Conditions for your Assessment

For the test to take place you must;

Bring your photocard driver’s licence with you; this must be presented before the Assessment.

Your licence should be at your current address and in date.

If you have the older style paper licence, then you will need to bring an acceptable form of photo identification such as a passport.

Eyesight must conform to current legislation (20m / 68ft) so if you require glasses /contact lenses then bring these with you.

You must provide a vehicle for the Assessment.

The vehicle must be in a roadworthy condition and comply with current road legislation i.e. taxed, MOT (if required), insured for the purpose of the assessment, meet current DVLA rules for number plates and fit for purpose i.e. for carrying passengers.

The vehicle must be right hand drive, have no more than 8 passenger seats, weigh no more than 3.5t, have 4 wheels, have head restraints on both front seats and have an unobstructed rear window. It must be able to do at least 62 mph and have an mph speedometer. A van or a convertible car is not classed as a suitable vehicle for a Taxi Assessment.

Interior of the car should be clean and free of all types of litter and clutter. The examiner will not be expected to conduct a test sat in a dirty seat and will be at liberty to terminate the test should the car interior be in a dirty or cluttered state

Be punctual, if you are later than 5 minutes the Assessment may be cancelled at the discretion of the Assessor and you will still be charged the full fee.

Appropriate footwear should be worn, for example, no flip flops, sandals or high heels.

Candidates are NOT PERMITTED to take the driving assessment in a Private Hire or Hackney plated vehicle except under the following 2 circumstances:

The vehicle is registered/plated to you, the candidate, and you have been referred to take the assessment by your Local Authority.

The vehicle is registered/plated to you and you want to change/be licensed to another Authority.

The Taxi Assessment

Please allow 1 hour for the assessment. You will be asked 2 maintenance related questions (show me / tell me) and be expected to drive for approximately 45 minutes on a variety of road types and be asked to perform 2 reversing manoeuvres with the possibility of a controlled stop. You will be asked to drive independently of directions for a 10 minute period following road signs and directions to a particular destination. There will be a 10 to 15 minute debrief at which point you will be advised of the result.

A maximum of 9 minor driving faults are allowed. If you exceed 9 minor driving faults or commit any serious or dangerous faults, this will result in a failure.

Please note that if you take your Assessment in an automatic, you may not be licenced by your authority to drive a manual vehicle. We suggest that you refer back to your Local Authority for guidance.

From time to time, a Senior Assessor may sit in during an Assessment for quality control purposes.

You may cancel or change the appointment date up to 5 working days prior to the test without incurring costs other than forfeiture of the credit card surcharge (if any) if you cancel. If you do not give the required notice, you will not receive any refund whatsoever and re-booking will attract the full fee.

We wish you luck with the assessment, if you require any further clarification or advice then please contact the office on 0300 777 0157 option 2 or email taxi.blt@bluelamptrust.org.uk
